definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: What kind of outstanding stunt was he doing during these three years?
sentences.chinese: 這三年裏，他都練些什麼絕技呢？

sentences.english: He is deadly with a blade.
Scientists actually know little about how animals perform their navigational feats.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們對動物的這種導航絕技卻是孤陋寡聞的。

sentences.english: The magician's best trick was to make the woman in the box vanish.
sentences.chinese: 那名魔術師最厲害的絕技是讓箱子裏的女人消失。

sentences.english: He did athletic stunts on bamboo ladders.
sentences.chinese: 他在竹梯上表演了體育絕技。

sentences.english: China's research and special clever stunt performance experts.
sentences.chinese: 中國絕技研究及特技奇技表演專家。

sentences.english: Skills of living, Ultimate body effect, Newness appearance, Healthy & safety.
sentences.chinese: 養生絕技，內調外護，容顏更新，健康安全。

sentences.english: The aeroplanes were flying upside down and doing other stunts.
sentences.chinese: 飛機正在表演倒飛和其他絕技。

sentences.english: I am not a man of hidden talents but I may be considered as a jack of all trades .
sentences.chinese: 我隨說不上是一個身懷絕技的人，但也算是個萬事通。

sentences.english: Due to some hereditary miracle in the people who joined the circus.
sentences.chinese: 由於有些加入馬戲團的人身懷祖傳絕技。

sentences.english: Shao-lin unique er-zhi-zen is the representative of hawk's claw.
sentences.chinese: 少林絕技二指禪是少林鷹派武術的代表性套路。

sentences.english: In the mean time, the skills of Olympic gold medal will appear in the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 同時，在奧運金牌中使用的金鑲玉絕技也會亮相。

sentences.english: Would you the undulation of one wave, its trick to me transfer.
sentences.chinese: 倘若你肯將一個波浪起伏的絕技傳授給我。

sentences.english: The moment Master Chou finished his incredible tongue twister, audiences just went buzzing.
sentences.chinese: 周師傅一表演繞口令絕技之後觀衆就沸騰了。

sentences.english: In July 2007, an acrobat cycles the high-wire – a stunning feat.
sentences.chinese: 月，一名雜技團演員在表演高空自行車走鋼絲絕技。

definition: to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
handed down in a family/family traditions
